meanings.definition: Used or adapted for use with only one eye.
meanings.sent1: He preferred using a monocular telescope for stargazing.
meanings.sent2: The monocular lens helped him see distant objects clearly.
meanings.sent3: The pirate wore a monocular eyepatch to look fashionable.
meanings.sent4: Her monocular vision of the world made her appreciate details others missed.
meanings.sent5: The monocular view through the keyhole revealed a hidden room.

meanings.definition: A device designed for use with only one eye.
meanings.sent1: He always carried his monocular when birdwatching.
meanings.sent2: The explorer used a monocular to spot wildlife in the dense forest.
meanings.sent3: The detective's monocular was mistaken for a spy gadget.
meanings.sent4: The monocular acted like a magic lens, revealing hidden messages in the painting.
meanings.sent5: The monocular revealed a tiny world within the tree's hollow.
